snippet: The obstacles for President Obama in Arizona are considerable, but his aides say a victory is possible in a state that analysts believe is heading Democratic.
abstract: Pres Obama's re-election campaign is dispatching workers across Arizona's college campuses and Latino neighborhoods, registering as many new voters as they can in an organized, three-month effort to determine whether they can put the state into play for Democrats; if successful, the campaign's efforts would provide powerful evidence of the political and demographic changes that seem to be slowly moving across Arizona, largely due to an increase in Latino populations.
lead_paragraph: The obstacles for President Obama in Arizona are considerable, but his aides say a victory is possible in a state that analysts believe is heading Democratic.

headline.seo: Obama Campaign Turns Attention on Arizona
headline.main: Obama Camp, Seeing Shift, Bets on Long Shot in Arizona
headline.print_headline: Obama Camp, Sensing Shift, Bets on a Long Shot, Arizona
